definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Try to make at least three people smile a day.
sentences.chinese: 請大顯身手，每天至少引領三個人開心張笑口。

sentences.english: This is where the registry steps in.
sentences.chinese: 這正是註冊中心大顯身手的地方。

sentences.english: Color psychologists also work in the decorating field.
sentences.chinese: 同樣，色彩心理學家也在家裝領域大顯身手。

sentences.english: Therefore all of staff in our company revelries together on afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 下午，公司全體員工狂歡，化妝師們大顯身手。

sentences.english: The wind came out to play one day.
Which is where the New New face comes in.
sentences.chinese: 這就是新新臉蛋大顯身手的地方。

sentences.english: It's time to blow the big one, am I right?
sentences.chinese: 該是大顯身手的時候了，你說我說的對嗎？

sentences.english: Now they're back, and ready to reassert themselves.
sentences.chinese: 現在它們捲土重來，準備要大顯身手。

definition: hissing sound/to hiss (as a sign of displeasure)
extremely rare (idiom)/once in a blue moon
to charge and break through enemy lines
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
cheerleading squad/also written 啦啦隊|啦啦队
